notes.note:
Updated Firefox Login Manager to allow HTTPS pages to use saved HTTP logins. It’s one more way Firefox is supporting [Let’s Encrypt][1] and [helping users transition to a more secure web][2].


  [1]: https://letsencrypt.org/
  [2]: https://matthew.noorenberghe.com/blog/2016/08/filling-saved-http-logins-over-https-same-domain

Added features to Reader Mode that make it easier on the eyes and the ears

 - Controls that allow users to adjust the width and line spacing of
   text 
 - Narrate, which reads the content of a page out loud
Improved video performance for users on systems that support SSSE3 without hardware acceleration
Added context menu controls to HTML5 audio and video that let users loops files or play files at 1.25x speed

Enhancements for Mac users 

 - Improved performance on OS X systems without hardware acceleration
 - Improved appearance of anti-aliased OS X fonts
Improvements in about:memory reports for tracking font memory usage
Improve performance on Windows systems without hardware acceleration

Ended Firefox for Mac support for [OS X 10.6, 10.7, and 10.8][1]. 


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/futurereleases/2016/04/29/update-on-firefox-support-for-os-x/
Ended Firefox for Windows support for SSE processors

Re-enabled the default for [Graphite2 font shaping][1] 


  [1]: http://graphite.sil.org/

Added a [Cause column][1] to the Network Monitor to show what caused each network request

  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor#Cause_column
Fixed an issue that prevented users from updating Firefox for Mac unless they originally installed Firefox. Now, those users as well as any user with administrative credentials can update Firefox.

Older installations of Websense (before version 8.1) may cause a [startup crash for Windows users][1]


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/websense-startup-crashes-firefox

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows XP SP2
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10
 - Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2

*Please note that 64-bit builds of Firefox are only supported on Windows 7 and higher.*

### Recommended Hardware

-  512MB of RAM
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- Mac OS X 10.9
- Mac OS X 10.10
- Mac OS X 10.11

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 3.4 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher

  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/get-latest-version-firefox-windows-xp-vista
